enWisdom: The hearts are locks and their keys are inquiry
One who seeks right guidance becomes knowledgeable [about it]

Wisdom: سَلْ عَمَّا لَا بُدَّ لَكَ مِنْ عِلْمِهِ وَلَا تُعْذِرُ فِي جَهْلِهِ
enWisdom: Ask about that which you must know and cannot be excused for being ignorant about
One who has knowledge asks good [and pertinent] questions

Wisdom: مَنْ سَأَلَ فِي صِغَرِهِ أَجَابَ فِي كِبَرِهِ
enWisdom: One who asks in his young age, answers in his old age

Wisdom: لَا يُؤْخَذُ الْعِلْمُ إِلَّا مِنْ أَرْبَابِهِ
enWisdom: Knowledge is not acquired except from its masters

Wisdom: لَا تَسْأَلَنَّ عَمَّا لَمْ يَكُنْ فَفِي الَّذِي قَدْ كَانَ عِلْمٌ كَافٍ
enWisdom: Never ask about that which has not [yet] happened, for in that which has already come about there is enough knowledge [that one can gain]

Wisdom: إِذَا سَأَلْتَ فَاسْأَلْ تَفَقُّهاً وَلَا تَسْأَلْ تَعَنُّتاً فَإِنَّ الْجَاهِلَ الْمُتَعَلِّمَ شَبِيهٌ بِالْعَالِمِ وَإِنَّ الْعَالِمَ الْمُتَعَسِّفَ شَبِيهٌ بِالْجَاهِلِ
enWisdom: When you ask, ask in order to learn and do not ask in order to embarrass [the one whom you are asking]Indeed the ignorant one who learns is similar to a learned person and verily the learned one who is oppressive is similar to an ignorant person

Wisdom: أَلَا لَا يَسْتَقْبِحَنَّ مَنْ سُئِلَ [مَنْ يَعْلَمُ إِنْ سُئِلَ‏] عَمَّا لَا يَعْلَمُ أَنْ يَقُولَ لَا أَعْلَمُ
enWisdom: Indeed, the one who is asked about that which he does not know should never consider it demeaning to say “I don’t know”
